Legal_Issue: Unreasonable H&C decision due to factual errors and lack of consideration for hardship
Application_Facts: Family members' ages mischaracterized; evidence of past suffering neglected; no new evidence in PRRA
Decision_Outcome: H&C decision set aside; matter referred back for redetermination; PRRA decision upheld
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of negative PRRA and H&C decisions
Court_Ruling: H&C decision overturned and referred for redetermination; procedural limitations noted but not dispositive
Claimant_Status: Unrepresented litigants; family members applying separately but reviewed together
Grounds_for_Claim: Factual errors in H&C assessment; failure to consider hardship; inadequate reasoning
Assessment_Factor: Hardship upon return to Kenya; credibility of claims; age of family members
Procedural_Issue: Separate applications filed by each family member; procedural limitations due to unrepresented status
Review_Standard: Judicial review under Federal Court Rules, including Rule 302 (single order requirement)
Evidence_Used: Evidence of past suffering in Kenya; family composition and ages
Application_Basis: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) grounds; Pre-Removal Risk Assessment (PRRA)
Evidence_Assessed: Mischaracterization of family members' ages; lack of consideration of past trauma
Relief_Sought: Overturning of H&C and PRRA decisions; permission to remain in Canada
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to properly consider submitted evidence on hardship and family circumstances
Outcome: H&C decision set aside; redetermination ordered for all family members
Harm_Assessment: Risk of hardship and re-traumatization upon return to Kenya
Cause_Description: Family challenged negative PRRA and H&C decisions regarding return to Kenya
Evidence_Handling: Errors in interpretation and omission of key evidence in H&C decision
Evidence_Issues: Mischaracterization of facts; neglect of relevant evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient and unreasonable evaluation of evidence in H&C decision
Decision_Rationale: Reviewable errors identified in H&C decision; no error found in PRRA due to lack of new evidence
Decision_Making_Body: Immigration authorities (H&C and PRRA officers); reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Inaccurate factual premises; failure to address key evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Standard of reasonableness in administrative decision-making
